text: Hey everyone and welcome to this week's
news and community spotlights. Last week
we released the new and improved
Staccobot sample completely rebuilt for
Unreal Engine 5.6. The sample is perfect
for anyone and everyone with new
features like dynamic cameras,
intelligent NPC behaviors driven by
state tree and advanced systems for
procedural content generation and chaos
physics. Stackbot allows you to create
immersive and engaging worlds with ease.
You can read all about it at
unreligent.com/feed
and get the stackobot sample on Fab.
Cory Williams found inspiration in a
charming wooden toy he crafted for his
children, uncovering the enchanting
stories and characters woven within.
Discover how he skillfully brought this
creativity to life in our spotlight on
Silly Crocodile. It's a delightful
journey you won't want to miss.
For all of our developers who use Unreal
Engine on Linux, Unreal version 5.7 will
transition from SDL2 to SDL3. If you've
customized SDL2 for your projects,
you'll likely need to make some
adjustments for SDL3 to ensure a smooth
upgrade. We look forward to see all the
amazing things you create with the new
tools and enhancements in 5.7.
Join your local chapter to learn, grow,
and be inspired. Here are some upcoming
events to check out.
And now for this week's amazing
community spotlights.
Technical environment artist Magnus
Telman has unveiled a stunning new scene
titled stylized cave. Inspired by the
captivating art styles of games like
Genchin Impact and Ka Bridge of Spirits,
Telman focused on creating a small
immersive cave environment. Throughout
the project, he honed his skills in
sculpting rocks using ZBrush and
experimented with Substance Painter to
enhance the mood and aesthetic. You can
find more of his work on his art
station.
In Rusty Town, 3D environment artist
Vladimir Stapuk has created a
metal-on-metal scene that is far from
being destined for the scrapyard.
Vladimir handcrafted this phenomenally
detailed environment using Maya,
Substance, and Unreal Engine to bring it
to life. You can explore the breakdown
of his works on Art Station or check it
out yourself on Fab.
Jong Hyong Bang, a highly skilled 3D
character artist, has masterfully
brought to life the legendary heroine
Mui Ying from Chinese folklore. This
breathtaking depiction not only
showcases her heroic stature, but also
immerses viewers in the rich cultural
heritage of ancient China. Drawing
inspiration from the striking concept
art of Bobo, Bong's work pays meticulous
attention to the intricate details of
the character's costume, hair, and
numerous materials, ensuring a realistic
and authentic recreation. The armor and
textiles are crafted with precision,
reflecting the artistry of the period,
while the colors and textures evoke the
heroism and strength of Muying as a
warrior. It's clear that an immense
amount of care and dedication went into
every aspect of this piece. From the
delicate embroidery on the garments to
the expression of determination in her
gaze, this artistic endeavor sets the
standard, showcasing not only technical
prowess, but a deep respect for the
culture it represents as well. You can
find more of Bong's stunning work on
their art station.
Thank you so much for watching and we'll
catch you next time.
